title: The GR 20
description: Considered to be the most difficult of all trails in Europe, the GR 20 is a footpath that traverses the Mediterranean island of %location% from north to south along its spiny mountainous backbone, and it took %days% to complete it.

Known locally as Fra Li Monti (Corsican for 'across the mountains'), it covers a distance of %distance%. Between the northern starting point at Calenzana and the end at Conca in the south, there are hidden mountain lakes, expansive sea views, rugged and rocky cliffs, and remarkable panoramas.
